content:
Diagnosis
	1. Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of bladder, T3bN2M1
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 TURBT - incomplete resection due to muscle invasion

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin AUC5/Etoposide 100mg/m2 D1-3 q21 days - 4 cycles completed March 2024
	2. Atezolizumab maintenance 1200mg q21 days commenced April 2024

	Radiotherapy
	Prophylactic cranial irradiation 25Gy in 10 fractions completed 15 April 2024

	Clinical studies
	Not enrolled

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on maintenance immunotherapy

	Current issues
	Grade 2 fatigue
Mild immune-related thyroiditis

	Summary of consultation
	This 67-year-old gentleman has completed first-line platinum/etoposide chemotherapy for metastatic small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of the bladder, achieving stable disease. Initial staging showed extensive pelvic lymphadenopathy and widespread metastatic disease. He completed 4 cycles with good tolerance apart from grade 2 fatigue. Restaging CT in March 2024 confirmed stable disease and he proceeded to prophylactic cranial irradiation followed by maintenance atezolizumab.

He has developed mild thyroiditis on immunotherapy requiring thyroxine replacement but otherwise tolerating treatment well. Latest thyroid function shows TSH 5.2 with normal free T4. Performance status remains 1.

On examination today, he has stable abdominal findings with no new concerns. Recent cystoscopy shows no local progression.

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis booked for 20 May 2024
TFTs to be monitored weekly

	Medication prescribed
	Atezolizumab 1200mg q21 days
Levothyroxine 50mcg daily

	Follow up
	Transferring care to local oncology unit at [redacted name] Hospital
Next immunotherapy due 15 May 2024
Requires 3-monthly CT imaging

	Required GP actions
	Weekly TFT monitoring
Urgent referral back if new neurological symptoms

cancer_timeline.value: TURBT - incomplete resection due to muscle invasion
Started Carboplatin AUC5/Etoposide 100mg/m2 D1-3 q21 days
Completed 4 cycles of Carboplatin/Etoposide with stable disease
Completed prophylactic cranial irradiation 25Gy in 10 fractions
Developed immune-related thyroiditis on Atezolizumab requiring thyroxine replacement

patient_facts.value: Stable abdominal findings with no new concerns

status_updates.value: Metastatic small cell neuroendocrine bladder cancer with stable disease after platinum/etoposide, now on maintenance immunotherapy. Transferring care to local unit.
Grade 2 fatigue and immune-related thyroiditis requiring thyroxine replacement
Continuing Atezolizumab 1200mg q21 days with thyroid monitoring
Transferring care to local oncology unit, next immunotherapy due 15 May 2024
